info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 12:35PM MDT until June 3 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado...
Colorado River above Grand Lake affecting Grand County.
.Moderate to heavy rain Monday afternoon into Tuesday morning will fall on a primed snowpack leading to additional runoff. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and produce minor lowland flooding.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected.
* WHERE...Colorado River above Grand Lake.
* WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 7.6 feet, Water begins to impact low lying areas along the river. At 7.7 feet, Approaches to foot bridges and trails along and crossing the river are flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 12:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 6.8 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 7.9 feet just after midnight tonight.
- Action stage is 7.6 feet.
- Flood stage is 8.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH
